Buid IDs: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.1.17)
Gecko/20110121 Firefox/3.5.17 and Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6;
rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

After updating from Firefox 3.5.17 to Firefox 4.0 RC1 on Mac 10.6.6, the download which was in progress is shown as completed, even if, in fact, the file is not completely downloaded. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a profile using FF 3.5.17.
2. Start downloading a sufficiently large file to keep the download running through the update (eg: http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/download).
3. Go to Help -> Check for Updates and install the update.

Actual Results:
After the update is installed and FF restarts, the download which was in progress is now shown as completed, even if, in fact, the file is not completely downloaded. 

Expected Results:
After the update is installed, the download which was in progress should continue downloading.
